Jet boat collided with bank, then spun around and ended up side on. One person was thrown from the boat and another was severely injured.

Vessel on port side failed to give way to a ferry. The ferry sounded 5 blasts on the horn but the other vessel did not slow or alter course and the ferry was forced to come to a complete stop by engaging reverse.
Event Location: Paihia Bay/Russell Transit, Bay of Islands

Brief Description: Launch navigated wide around pole to clear a yacht coming through, and narrowly avoided a collision with a kite surfer off the starboard side 5-7 metres away travelling in the same direction.
Main engine appeared laboured and losing RPM, followed by an increase of the engine's exhaust temperature. Chief Engineer shut down the main engine and arranged for the vessel to be towed to port.
Jet Boat made contact with boulder in river.
Jet boat ran aground and required tractor tow recovery.  No damage or injuries.
Whilst berthing a ferry made contact with another ferry. There were no injuries or significant vessel damage.
Event Location: Sealink, Hamer Street Berth, Westhaven, Auckland

Brief Description: Whilst berthing a ferry made contact with another ferry. There were no injuries or significant vessel damage.
Event Location: Sealink, Hamer Street Berth, Westhaven, Auckland

Brief Description: Individual trespassed onto passenger ferry at berth, acting aggressively toward crew and discharging fire extinguishers on board the vessel. Crew barricaded themselves in the wheelhouse and police were dispatched.

Crew had been conducting maintenance checks on ferry. As crew were preparing to run water through the forward hydrant, a crew member attempted to remove a metal camlock. The cap was under pressure and struck the man's knee, causing a deep cut.
Passenger on a dive charter trip slipped and pulled muscle in his arm and shoulder.
Container ship was given order to progress but was unable to do so due to engine issues. Vessel was sent for repair.
Crew member on board cruise vessel hit by closing door while carrying a tray of tea, sustaining hot water burns to their right forearm.
Jet boat driver missed turn and beached boat, passengers were transferred to spare boat. No injuries or damage.
Jet boat driver chose wrong channel and ran aground, there were no injuries or damage.
Failure of jet boat's starboard engine. Vessel able to safely navigate to a safe area using its port engine.

Stevedore was coiling wire as it was being loaded by the ship's crane. When the crane lifted away it caught on the steel box the wire was coiled into, which made contact with the stevedore's foot, causing a laceration and fracture.
Passenger's knee locked up as a result of an existing injury, with passenger unable to stand or disembark the vessel. Ambulance was called and the passenger was assisted off vessel by EMTs.
Vessel caught by wind gust and blown into concrete wall.
Driver turned boat to pickup patient during training exercise, at the same time a swell lifted the rear of the boat and it slowly rolled over. There were no injuries or damage.
Wind picked up IRB and flipped it as it was heading over a wave. There were no injuries or damage.
Collision between two college rowing boats. There was minor damage to one boat and no injuries.
Skier fell during water ski racing event, resulting in vertebra facture.
Propulsion failure of engine due to fuel line leak.
Operator grounded jetboat while travelling downstream to rock burn confluence.
Container ship's automatic identification system (AIS) was defective affecting the performance of other piloting equipment.
Vessel made PAN-PAN call to rescue centre due to water ingress in their bilge. Crew were able to repair bilge pumps and the call for assistance was cancelled.
Passenger fainted on top deck of the vessel, sliding off their seat and hitting their head. Crew called an ambulance and returned to base.
Driver caught nose of boat and breached whilst out checking parts of river suitable for stopping. There were no injuries or damage.
Passenger fell down a set of stairs, dislocating their arm.
Longline fishing vessel collision with a recreational yacht.

Craypot being hauled snagged as the boat rose on a swell. This put pressure on the winch and the jammed pot then ripped the side stays of the wheelhouse causing damage to the mast, boom and overhang. There were no injuries.
Event Location: Star Keys, Pitt Island. Chatham Islands

Brief Description: Passenger got debris in eye. Eye was washed with saline solution.
Event Location: Downstream from Karapiro Dam, Waikato River

Brief Description: Equipment failure - depth sounder giving intermittent fault.
Passenger ferry ran aground with 57 passengers and 10 crew on board. The master made a mayday call, and crew and passengers were transferred to two fishing vessels and returned to port.
Crew member on a trawler not wearing adequate footwear slipped on a step and sustained a minor back injury.
Bulk carrier observed port side windlass to be inoperable as vessel was preparing to shift from harbour anchorage to berth. The defective equipment was repaired by ship crew.
Driver attempted to manoeuvre down one side of a river channel but ended up grounding the vessel in between the two channels.
Event Location: Head of Mt Alfred, Dart River

Brief Description: IRB flipped after the engine became clogged with seaweed. There were no injuries or damage.
Vessel clipped a beacon whist coming into the entrance of the harbour. There was some damage to vessel but no injuries.

Wake generated by ferry as it entered basin caused disturbance of a vessel at berth, resulting in its forward starboard cleat failing. Skipper and deckhand took action to keep vessel alongside without mooring lines.

Fisherman fell off their kayak and was unable to get back on due to water ingress, they clung onto their friend's kayak until a passing waka ama paddler called emergency services on their mobile phone. Lifeguards attended in an IRB.
Boat was tied to wharf when a wind gust ripped the mast out. The boat fell on its side, and as the tide was out the vessel sustained some damage.
Jet ski towing sea biscuit collided with a sea wall, injuring three people, one seriously.
Engineer had fall in the engine room.  Taken by ambulance to hospital.
Fire resulting in six persons abandoning the vessel and being rescued by Police.
Driver capsized IRB after misjudging large wave. There were no injuries or damage.
Crew member sustained hot water burns to their foot. Crew member received first aid treatment for burns and was subsequently treated in hospital.

Yacht was proceeding under power when it was overtaken by a large displacement launch at speed, and within 50m. Yacht reduced speed and conducted round turn to starboard. The speed at which the launch overtook caused a ground swell to the marina.
Vessel grounded whilst towing another vessel out of shallow water. Engine low flow alarms sounded so crew shut down both engines and cleaned strainer baskets.
IRB rolled over while conducting training exercise.
Crewperson stepped off trawler onto wharf, due to high tide the step down was over 1m; crewperson landed awkwardly and sustained a fractured foot.
Passenger on jetboat experienced discomfort after travelling through some rapids. Passenger and caregiver/s disembarked and they were driven back to the office.
Crewmember strained back whilst lifting mooring block. This was an existing injury which had not healed correctly.
Kayak passengers failed to properly affix the spraydeck, which allowed water ingress into kayak, resulting in its capsize. Passengers swam to shore and carried Kayak onto nearby rocks.
Man on paddleboard was blown 5km from his departure point. He had no beacon, lifejacket or phone so a plane was mobilised to locate him and he was found approximately 7 hours after he set out.
Jet boat grounded.  Passengers transferred to another vessel and the  grounded vessel towed back to base.
Engine lost power and shut down. Engine filter changed and the vessel resumed voyage.
Pilot reports that vessel was unable to override their engine power limiter making it difficult to manoeuvre during departure.
Jet boat grounded. Passengers transferred to another vessel and jet boat towed back to base. No injuries sustained.
Jet boat grounded on sand bar whilst undertaking a spin. There were no injuries or damage to the vessel. The vessel was refloated and the tour continued.
Stevedore walking on edge of bay slipped and fell several metres onto a companion way, sustaining cuts to the back and several broken ribs.
Port side ECDIS screen was observed to have an error message. Several attempts were made to reboot the system which were unsuccessful. The vessels other ECDIS was assigned to master station.
Recreational vessel taking part in a fishing competition was half sunk when it hit a partially submerged log. There were no injuries and the crew members were rescued from the water.
Alerts were received for a yacht with engine failure and ripped sails. Coastguard responded and the yacht was towed into harbour.
Small fire on cargo ship caused by welding sparks igniting a section of rope, the fire was extinguished by fire watch crew member.
Crew member slipped whilst reaching for stern line and fell overboard. Crew member uninjured and was able to swim to shore.
Yacht dragged anchor whilst secured and collided with another yacht, causing damage to the hull.
Yacht dragged anchor whilst secured and collided with another yacht, causing damage to the hull.
Passenger vessel experienced propulsion failure on departure from berth. Passengers were transferred to other vessels.
Event Location: Arthurs Bay, Bay of Many Coves, Queen Charlottle Sound

Brief Description: Due to strong winds yacht washed up on the beach. Volunteers towed vessel back out to mooring.
Collision between a single and a double skiff rowing skiff on Avon River.
Jet beach beached after driver took the wrong channel. There were no injuries or damage.
Event Location: Downstream of the Glacier Burn, Dart River

Brief Description: Jet Boat driver veered into a narrow channel to avoid a beached boat, and subsequently also grounded. There were no injuries or damage to the vessel.
Vessel grounded on rocks creating an oil spill.

Skipper of a regatta support vessel rescued two males attempting to paddle back to shore in an inflatable pool boat that had been blown approximately 1nm from the beach. Skipper deflated the boat and took the men back to shore.
Outboard motor in dingy caught fire and vessel then collided with a seawall, the Coastguard rescued occupants and towed dinghy to safety.
Large waves caused vessel to roll heavily. Cabin beds within the vessel were unanchored and shifted from one side of the cabins to the other.
Crew member fell overboard during vessel turn. Driver returned to pick up crew member, who was uninjured.
IRB rolled due to insufficient engine power to pass over cresting wave.
The number two air compressor was out of operation, delivery of spare parts were organised. The other two air compressors remained operational for vessel propulsion.
Jet boat grounded in channel.  Passengers transferred to another vessel.   No injuries or damage sustained.
Vessel grounded following anchor failure.
Passenger fell down stairs, sustaining wounds to their head. They were taken to Dunedin Hospital for treatment.
Vessel stopped and it was found to have made contact with a buoy. There were no injuries or damage.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Yacht was damaged during race competition. Coastguard responded and assisted with repairs.
IRB driver flipped boat in rough seas. There were no injuries or damage.
Female crewing IRB was knocked off balance by wave, fracturing her lower leg.
Ferry passenger fell over and dislocated  their finger. Crew assisted and helped to arrange transportation of the passenger to hospital.
Mayday call made from the skipper of boat with engine issues. Vessel was able to make it back to shore on its port engine.
Recreational fishing vessel was hit by another vessel. There was damage to the fishing vessel and injuries to four people.
Trawler skipper misjudged turn and made contact with a rock. Vessel sustained only superficial damage.

Commercial boat had to do an emergency stop as there were a number of private boats heading towards it and there was not enough room to pass. The commercial boat stopped in a shallow area and needed to flush the sand trap afterwards.

Passenger ferry skipper noticed smoke coming through the vents after dropping anchor, skipper closed air vents and fuel valves. Advised passengers to remain inside main cabin and then transferred them to another vessel. There were no injuries.
Passenger on cruise ship had a serious medical event.
Jet boat operator grounded whilst checking the river for changes after recent floods. There were no injuries or damage.
Jet boat driver needed to make a stop in an unknown area, due to low water flow the boat grounded.
Jet boat port engine stopped due to electrical fault. Engine was rewired and vessel continued its trip.

Contractor working on ferry accidentally hit emergency stop. Engine #1 and non essential power shut down automatically. Engines #3 and #4 remained on and the ferry remained on its course at a reduced speed.
Event Location: Inbetween Tongue Point and Red Rocks, Cook Strait

Brief Description: Crew member slipped on step, fell and cut their head.
Collision of three jet skis due to travelling too close to one another. No injuries.
Collision of three jet skis due to travelling too close to one another. No injuries.
Jib sheave on crane disintegrated. As the stevedores finished removing gear from the hold the bearing collapsed again.
Fishing vessel struck bar whilst entering harbour, sustained a hole in its hull and began taking on water. Skipper managed to refloat vessel and return to port.

Vessel glanced the side of a cave whilst completing an S bend to manoeuvre through cave. Impact caused one of five sections of the boat to deflate. Vessel returned to the beach and was removed from service for the day.
Travelling river, vessel touched bottom with prop.  Drifted back to reset course and adjusted load and then crossed shallow point in the narrows again.
Entering the ferry basin, approaching vessel failed to give way. Appropriate action taken to avoid collision.
Entering the ferry basin, approaching vessel failed to give way. Appropriate action taken to avoid collision.
Vessel made contact with floating debris, possibly a branch or log.  Skipper disabled the engine and arranged for vessel to be towed back to wharf.
Jet boat driver drove into an unfamiliar channel in error and beached in shallow water. There were no damage or injuries.
Event Location: 500m downstream of Routeburn River, Dart River

Brief Description: Jet boat ran aground after exiting backwater at a slow speed. There were no injuries or damage.
Returning to wharf, master was momentarily distracted.  Vessel was in idle position, but wind and tide caused vessel to drift and make contact with the anchor roller of a moored vessel.
Whilst setting nets a crew member's leg was trapped by one of the ropes and they were pulled overboard. The crew member freed themself and was helped back on board. They received minor injuries.
Event Location: South East of Opunake, Taranaki Coastline

Brief Description: Launch grounded on rocks after dragging its anchor. There was damage to the hull, and the vessel began taking on water. Skipper called Coastguard and swam to shore.
Power boat crashed and sunk during race. Boat was marked with buoys and was retrieved the following day. No injuries sustained.
Event Location: Waihou River, cnr Hauraki and Captain Cook Roads

Brief Description: Yacht grounded on sand and became stuck between a rock and the shore. Vessel was refloated at high tide.
Passenger on charter fishing trip fell off seat whilst vessel was crossing bar, sustaining a minor shoulder injury.
Vessel was towing a barge when the weather changed and swell increased. The vessel navigated into port and after assessment it was discovered the ramp had broken its safety pin points.
Vessel was towing a barge when the weather changed and swell increased. The vessel navigated into port and after assessment it was discovered the ramp had broken its safety pin points.
Jet boat driver missed turn off and ran aground in shallow water. There were no injuries or damage.
Event Location: 200m Downstream of Routeburn River, Dart River

Brief Description: Fatal medical event during a commercial operation.
Passenger on charter fishing vessel missed the first step while descending a set of stairs and fell. Passenger sustained a head injury and was returned to shore to receive medical treatment.
Deckhand sustained a fractured wrist while onboard.
IRB vessel capsized by a large wave. There were no injuries or damage.
Inflatable boat was rear ended by another vessel, sustaining damage to its outboard motor.

Maritime Radio received a call from a runabout with five occupants that had been swamped by waves and was taking on water. The main motor had failed and the auxiliary was struggling. Coastguard towed the boat to safety.
Vessel pitched sharply while crossing the bar at Raglan. One member of the crew was unable to maintain their grip on the handholds and fell to the back of the boat, sustaining a back injury.
Passenger vessel near waterfall made contact with an obstruction. No bilge alarms sounded, vessel was put astern and back out clear of the falls. Initial visual inspection didn't reveal any damage.
Two four pair college rowing skiffs were observed racing on a river early in the morning with no lights on their bows.
Event Location: Tamaki Estuary/River, Close to Seaside Park

Brief Description: Crew member fell from damaged crane platform, sustaining injuries to their legs.

Vessel with 5 passengers found fishing over Cook Strait cable.  After coastguard told vessel to depart area the vessel was swamped by a wave and started listing. Coastguard escorted vessel back to Tory Channel.

Port side engine cut out whilst travelling at cruising speed. Engine room checks showed oil egress from port side engine. Engine room monitoring was done with CCTV for the rest of the journey and a full mechanical inspection was to be completed.
Jet skis collided when one of them failed to give way. No injuries sustained and riders were escorted back to shore by the jet ski operator.
Event Location: Approx 3km south of Mou Tapu Island, Lake Wanaka

Brief Description: Dragonboat team was paddling past the boat ramp when a boat passed exceeding the 5 knots speed limits.
While coming into berth, strong wind pushed vessel into wharf.
Yacht anchored too close to shore and grounded at low tide.

Skipper cleaning fuel tanks left for the day. The isolator had leaky valve causing a slow leak. This leak caused tank to backfill, and overflow from inspection hatch into the bilge, of which the bilge was going.
Vessel entering harbour lost power and pitch control. Auxiliary generator started up power resumed.
Vessel collided with pier whilst berthing. Vessel was in-service with passengers on-board. No injuries.
Jet boat ran aground. No injuries or vessel damage were sustained and the jet boat tour continued.
Passenger slipped and fell, sustaining a fractured shoulder.

A freon leak occurred in the vessels processing factory. The factory was evacuated, and a precautionary muster successfully accounted for all crew.  Source of the leak was identified as a plate freezer hose, which was replaced.
On transit to Island, vessel lost propulsion. Vessel Owner/Engineer travelled out in another vessel and assisted with repair. Voyage continued.
Skipper felt a sudden shuddering of the vessel, halted and investigated engines and shafts, but could not identify any significant damage.

Operator assisted in search and rescue of adult and child kayakers who capsized in lake. Coastguard subsequently arrived, at which point the kayakers were transferred to their vessel for return to shore.
Jetboat lost power to engine and collided with a tree while drifting in fast flowing water. As vessel began to founder, passengers swam to shore.  No injuries.
Jetboat grounded in shallow water. There were no injuries or damage.
Kayak was a few kilometres off shore when the kayaker noticed it was filling with water. Kayak began to sink and kayaker activated their Personal Locator Beacon (PLB).
Boat shifted unexpectedly, causing two crew members to fall overboard. One sustained bruising to their cheek from contact with the propeller guard.
Boat was pushed forward by a wave, the lower pontoon dug in and the boat capsized. There were no injuries or damage.
Jet boat grounded. No injuries were sustained and passengers transferred to another vessel.
Jetboat improperly secured to jetty was caught by current and drifted a short distance downstream.
Jet boat grounded in river after completing a spin in shallow water. There were no injuries or damage.
Wake of passing passenger ferry caused extreme movement of ferry heading in opposite direction, resulting in a passenger falling and injuring their shoulder.
Commercial vessel was checking crop when the hydraulic control pump for the jet drive failed. The boat dropped anchor and arranged for a tow.
Solo sailor's yacht sustained damage, and made way to shelter from incoming bad weather before attempting repairs.
Electronic control system for main engine developed fault, vessel then deployed anchor and system was restarted. Journey was resumed after restart.
Vessel transferring to another wharf, when coming alongside vessel made contact with the wharf.  Minor damage to both wharf and vessel.  No injuries.
Engineer fell two metres down an internal ladder. After CT scan and X-Rays they were found to have a mild concussion and was discharged back to the vessel.
Container ship experienced steering gear issues on approach to New Zealand. Steering gear pump #4 was not able to be started remotely from the bridge and had to be started locally.
While vessel was under maintenance, deckhand moved to open a window and fell approximately three metres through open hatch. Deckhand incurred a cut to the shin and was taken to hospital for check up.
Propeller of boat engine scraped across a bar. Occupants pushed boat into deeper water and then propeller was lowered and the vessel continued on.
Loss of engagement on vessel due to suspected gear box fault so vessel secured safely and shut engines down before being towed back to wharf.
Passenger on chartered fishing trip was injured when a large wave hit the vessel.
Dragon boat took on water and capsized. There were some minor injuries and no damage.
Crane driver on board cargo ship unlatched the side window of the crane when it dislodged from the frame and fell into the hold of the vessel. There were no injuries.
Crew member required a medivac urgently due to a serious medical condition.
Event Location: SE of East Head, Banks Peninsula

Brief Description: Departing vessel worked engine up to Half Ahead then noticed the main engine RPM surging. Engineer requested for main engine to be limited to half speed.
Crew member sustained perforated eardrums after diving to a depth of approximately 10m to retrieve an object dropped overboard.
Digger operator smelled smoke whilst stowing logs on ship. Fire was put out with a fire extinguisher and was found to have been caused by friction between a rubber seal and exhaust outlet.
Crew member tripped while carrying a 20 Kg carton. The carton fell on an angle, with the corner striking the top of their finger. X-rays revealed a finger fracture.
Jet boat grounded after driver took wrong turn. There were no injuries or damage.
Yacht ran aground on bar and was towed by Coastguard to safety. Yacht skipper sustained minor injuries.

Barge was being assembled whilst tied to temporary wharf. Team member was seated, welding the base of the edge protection upright with their foot over the edge. As the swell lifted the pontoon their foot became stuck, causing a fracture.
Vessel moored at marina caught fire. Firefighters attempted to extinguish the fire but were unable to prevent it from sinking due to damage to its hull. There were no injuries.
Boatie called for help after vessel became stranded on rocks. Coastguard attended and towed vessel.
Ship's cook injured their elbow while loading supplies onto vessel.
Vessel engine fouled with seaweed. Driver managed to push boat upstream and into deep water. Passengers were transferred to back up boat to complete trip.
Crew member tripped on the lower deck accommodation entryway, sustaining a broken leg.
IRB driver hesitated in the breaking wave zone and then turned on a breaking wave causing the IRB to rollover. There were no injuries or damage.
IRB driver got caught on a shore break which caused the boat to flip towards the shore. There were no injuries or damage.
IRB driver turned to avoid a wave and collided with a lifeguard on a paddleboard. There were no injuries or damage.
Vessel engine fouled after entering area of dense kelp growth. Due to rough weather they called for assistance, with RCCNZ responding.

Launch with crew were travelling to fishing event and set anchor for the night. The anchor dragged and vessel grounded on rocks. Crew tried to push if off but it started taking on water. Coastguard was called and vessel was moved to another beach.
During loading of cargo onto bulk carrier, two strands of the crane's hoist wire snapped. Loading was halted immediately. There were no injuries.
Steering arm linkage on a work boat broke on the outboard motor causing loss of steerage. New steering arm was installed before continuing journey.
Work boat attempted to navigate bar 1.5 hours after low tide but still grounded. Boat was reversed out of the bar and then safely crossed into port 1.5 hours later.

Main engine commenced an unplanned slow down whilst the telegraph was set at full ahead. Engine slowed to dead slow ahead RPM for around 5-6 minutes. Full ahead revs slowly regained and the pilotage was completed without further incident.
Rescue vessel went to aid of person who fell out of kayak and unable to refloat kayak. Safely returned to shore with kayak and paddle. No injuries.

Due to stairwell being blocked and man cage not available, Stevedores had to climb ladder to get out of hold. Second climber got to top of ladder when they lost footing and fell 1.8 m onto the deck, sustaining a knee injury.
Trawler lost propulsion when oil pump on gearbox failed. Another vessel was dispatched to assist and pump was replaced with spare. Vessel returned to port with no assistance required.
Vessel was crossing bar when one engine shut down and the other engine presented an alarm. Skipper shut down the vessel, then restarted port engine and finished transit of bar.
Stevedore was walking portside when their leg went through a gap in the walkway, resulting in minor bruising.

Cruise ships thrusters malfunctioned as the ship was coming into port, this caused the ship to approach wharf too fast and the thruster alarm sounded. Tugs were positioned well to assist and crew acted immediately to correct vessel movement.
Near miss with another passenger vessel while coming into berth. Other vessel did not give way as per regulations engine was put into reverse to avoid collision.
Near miss with another passenger vessel while coming into berth. Other vessel did not give way as per regulations engine was put into reverse to avoid collision.
Maritime Radio received a call requesting urgent extraction of a passenger experiencing cardiac arrest. A rescue helicopter flew patient to hospital.

Vessel dragged anchor overnight and made contact with rocks. No one onboard at the time of the accident but vessel sustained a small hole in the chine in aft hold and damage to the duck board rudder and propeller damage.

Vessel departed berth and shortly after experienced a partial loss of power to some of the bridge electronics. Speed was reduced and systems were restarted which resolved the issue. There was no loss or propulsion or steering.
Steering jam due to a small stone getting wedged under the jet nozzle water cantering cone. Passengers transferred to another vessel to resume journey.
While performing a planned turn, jet boat beached in shallow water.  No injuries or damage.  Vessel continued on journey.
IRB driver hit a wave as it was peaking, the boat was then pushed backwards and went underwater, driver and crew fell out. There were no injuries or damage.
Vessel partially grounded on bar, and was refloated without damage or injuries.
Jet boat has minor damage to the stern rub rail after making contact with a rock as vessel passed it. No injuries.

Dredger grounded after a stray line became entangled in the propellers. The skipper immediately turned the engine off and dropped anchor but the anchor dragged, and with no ability to steer the vessel beached.
Jet boat ran aground on river bank. Operator able to push vessel back into river. No injuries, no damage.
Crew member slipped and twisted their knee while working in the hold during unloading.
While moving vessel to a new berth, vessel took longer to stop which resulted in a near miss with another vessel.  No injuries, no damage.
Discharging containers when one container fell approximately one meter.
Hydraulic pipe burst. Oil boom was deployed around vessel as additional precaution. A small amount of oil entered the water.
Recreational yacht ran aground and stranded on rocks.
Passenger sustained a back injury after vessel shifted heavily while crossing a large wave. Vessel returned to port and ambulance called.
Jet boat grounding during planned spin.  Passengers disembarked, vessel was pushed boat back into deeper water and continued on voyage.
Vessel collided with a navigation marker in harbour. Damage to marker and boat. Two passengers injured. Vessel towed back to boat ramp.
Emergency Medevac of seriously ill passenger.

Boat was towing another vessel when it hit a bridge, there was not sufficient head room even though this had been assessed before passing through. The boat's superstructure was damaged. There were no injuries.
Event Location: Outboard Boating Club Bridge, Tamaki Drive

Brief Description: Jetboat cruising up river, hit a sand bar and came to a sudden halt.  One crew member got thrown forward, hitting master on shoulder and then hitting his face and knee against side of vessel.  No medical attention required.
Hired kayak filled with water and was found to have a missing plug. Kayak was pulled into rocks and drained, and then operator arrived with replacement plug.

Fisherman onboard dinghy was knocked overboard by a wave. Fisherman inflated their lifejacket and was clear when the dinghy collided against rocks, damaging its motor. Dinghy was towed to main vessel.
Jet boat ran aground during a planned turn. No damage or injuries and vessel continued voyage.
While travelling under a dam, jetboat overturned and made contact with a rock.  15 passengers transferred to another vessel.  No injuries and minor damage to vessel.
During pre-departure engine room check, crew noticed engine start batteries overheated.  Engine turned off.  PPE gear worn and battery removed and replaced with new battery.  Voyage continued.
During jet boat spin, passenger hit their head on the dashboard and was taken to afterhours medical professional.
Jet boat grounded during a planned turn in shallow waters.
Driver of IRB underestimated the wave height causing the wave to impact the boat, the driver and crew person both lost their grip and fell out. There were no injuries or damage.
IRB hit wave and was pushed sideways and crew person was ejected from the boat, person got back in immediately. There was no injuries or damage.
Participant of waterski race event fell and fractured two back vertebrae.
Collision between two IRBs during a race, the vessels were obscured from each other by the surf. There was no damage and minor bruising.
Collision between two IRBs during a race, the vessels were obscured from each other by the surf. There was no damage and minor bruising.
Snorkeler aspirated some seawater whilst on a commercial diving trip. Crew assisted person back to shore.
Driver of IRB was coming out through surf when the crew person lost their grip and fell overboard.
As crew person placed hand on the bow ladder railing, the ladder opened forwards and the crew member fell overboard into the water.
Container ship lost power to main engine whilst coming in to berth. Two tug boats were used to berth ship.
Three people got onto yacht with no centre board or sails. Yacht started to sink and they were rescued by Coastguard.
Person suffering a medical event was evacuated by helicopter off a fishing charter.
Crew member suffered a stroke whilst on board ship and was transported by ambulance to hospital, they were to be medically evacuated back to their home country after a few days.
Jet boat driver made a late decision to turn down a channel and ended up beaching. There was no damage or injuries.
Charter vessel hit submerged object. The impact destroyed the sounder transducer. There were no injuries.
Event Location: North of Nine Pin Rock, Bay of Islands

Brief Description: Crew member caught finger in ponar sampling gear, and sustained a fractured finger.
Jet boat driver was attempting a planned turn when the vessel grounded. There were no injuries or damage.
Wave smashed in window on fishing vessel, crew checked vessel and travelled to port once weather subsided. There were no injuries.
Fatal medical event during a commercial operation.
Passenger on fishing charter fell back and hit their head.

Crew member was walking backwards down the gangway with the fuel hose and accidentally fell through the gap between the vessel and the gangway. Crew member was helped up and driven to medical centre and was assessed a with minor head injury.
Skipper misjudged the current when entering river and the vessel was swept towards a pile. Vessel made contact with the pile. There were no injuries and minor paint damage to the pile and vessel.
500 litres of oil was spilled onto ferry during refuelling, most of the spill was contained onboard.
Jet boat crashed on a Waita river. Two people were injured and attended to by ambulance service.
During a training session the vessel picked up someone out of the water, and then capsized on the next wave due to failure to turn. There were no injuries or damage.
Fatal accident during a commercial operation.
Skipper of vessel observed travelling past other vessels at high speed and in close proximity.
Rescue vessel attended a sinking boat and rescued the occupants, the rescue vessel advised they exceeded the speed limit briefly whilst making their way to the vessel in distress.
Rescue vessel attended a sinking boat and rescued the occupants, the rescue vessel advised they exceeded the speed limit briefly whilst making their way to the vessel in distress.
Skipper became disorientated and struck rock at the end of a reef. Skipper made their way back to port unassisted.
Event Location: Reef off Wallaby Creek, Abel Tasman National Park

Brief Description: IRB engine cut out in surf, driver attempted to restart but it cut out again. A wave then capsized the boat. There were no injuries or damage.
During the arrival of a bulk carrier, a kayak tried to cross its path. The ship sounded its horn and the kayak retreated.
Engine stopped on fishing launch, and power was lost to the reverse gear throttle. The boat then drifted into the concrete jetty pylon. There was no damage or injuries.
Container ship on approach to NZ advised that one of their generators was non operational. The remaining three generators were all fully functioning.
Engine in jet boat failed and the cause was later found to be a broken crank. A replacement boat pulled alongside and passengers transferred across without incident.
Tanker on approach to NZ advised their vessel had a bridge navigation watch alarm system failure.

Container ship advised prior to port entry that they had equipment failures including one engine breakdown, and one generator out of service. Shore service team attended and a risk assessment was carried out prior to leaving previous port.
Barge went up onto the bank on the side of a channel, the barge backed up and proceeded to berth. There was no damage or injuries.
Surge came through as vessel was departing berth and made contact with the hull of the ship anchored next to it. There was some minor damage and no injuries.

Vessel being delivered from overseas reported a loud thump and smoke coming from the emergency UPS battery room. Batteries had broken loose in rough weather, then shorted on the deck. There was no fire.
Event Location: North of Indonesia, en route to NZ

Brief Description: During testing on a cargo ship it was noted that the Reduction Gearbox oil temperature increased. The vessel was to remain at berth until the root cause was found and rectified.
Jet boat became beached after a spin. There were no injuries or damage.
Jet ski overturned during a training of new crew on how to handle one in surf conditions. There were no injuries or damage.
While returning from training exercise, one engine malfunctioned so had to return to berth on one engine.
Grounding of recreational vessel.  No environmental effects as spill was prevented.
Crew person was cutting bait and cut off tip of left thumb. Was taken into port and met by ambulance, treated at A&E and delivered back to fishing vessel.
Whilst ship was shifting in the harbour a catamaran came through and passed across the head of the ship. Short and rapid blasts were sounded but the catamaran continued on.
Whilst ship was shifting in the harbour a catamaran came through and passed across the head of the ship. Short and rapid blasts were sounded but the catamaran continued on.
Longline fisherman got hook stuck in hand after the line got stuck. The hook was removed onboard and wound cleaned.
Vessel was coming into berth with a stronger than normal tidal current, the stern was pushed around and the boat made contact with another vessel. There were no injuries.
After yacht crossed into the path of a bulk carrier, master tried unsuccessfully to sound ship's whistle. The pilot assisted in moving ship out of the channel and avoided a near miss.
A Stevedore climbing up the accommodation gangway hit their nose and face against a support beam. First aid was applied and stevedore was taken to medical centre by ambulance.
Car ferry made contact with mooring dolphin whilst berthing, causing some damage to the vessels starboard belting.
Tanker's main generator shut down, and the fault was found to be with the Fuel Injection Pump Actuator. The vessel was operational but needed tug assistance until the fault was cleared.
Jetboat hit shallow bar and ran aground. There was no damage or injuries.

As passenger vessel was approaching berth the wind picked up and pushed the boat sideways, causing it to come in contact with wooden pilings and then into another vessel. There was minor damage to both vessels.

As passenger vessel was approaching berth the wind picked up and pushed the boat sideways, causing it to come in contact with wooden pilings and then into another vessel. There was minor damage to both vessels.
Crew member sustained a cut to their hand while processing fish product, requiring stitches performed by vessel medic.
Whilst coming out of a gybe the helmsman put their foot on the edge of the boat and misjudged the width, their foot landed on the metal railing and the helmsman slipped and fell overboard.

Two sailboats collided during a race, one was unable to bear away and the other did a fast gybe to try and avoid but it collided anyway. directly after one of the boats was doing a quick gybe and the jib hit a crew person pushing them into the water.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Crew person in IRB fell out of boat during a turn and was subsequently hit by the boat, sustaining a laceration to the left side of their face.
Whilst gybing crew person stood up before the boom came down and was hit by it. Crew person was knocked unconscious.
Container ship en route to New Zealand reported its GMDSS equipment power amplifier was not operational due to damaged capacitor and PCB card. Arrangement was made to replace once in port.
Fishing vessel ran aground.  No injuries. Harbourmaster organised tugs for salvage.
While vessel was turning, chief engineer requested reduced speed to slow ahead due to issues with the engine cooler. After a few minutes the engineer gave all clear to increase back to half ahead.
Starboard engine of passenger ferry lost power whilst making a turn to approach the terminal. Skipper radioed to all traffic and safely docked at another berth.
Pilot ladder substandard with loose chocks and chocks missing.
Jetboat driver took wrong turn and beached.
Event Location: Downstream of Power Poles, Dart river

Brief Description: During jetboat training the driver had difficulty getting the boat off the beach, causing it to drift towards the bridge pillar and making contact with it.
During jetboat training the boat was partially beached. Crew member disembarked and refloated the boat.
Vessel dragged anchor during the night and drifted onto a beach, the anchor watch alarm woke crew who called for assistance to tow. Vessel had superficial damage.
While turning into wharf, vessel made contact with a wharf pile which brought the vessel to a sudden halt. Two passengers sustained minor injuries.
While alongside berth, auxiliary diesel generator failed as engine room prepared for cargo operation.  Unloading cargo stopped and crew told to prepare for possible black out.
Crew member fell from step while operating vessel crane, landing on their back and hitting their head.
Jet ski with two people broke down and started taking on water.  Coastguard rescued passengers and towed jet ski back to shore.
Jetboat grounded while travelling up river.
Jet boat grounded after taking wrong channel. Passengers transferred safely to another vessel and jet boat towed back to berth.

Crew person opened door of freezer at the same time as the boat lurched causing the door to swing open and slam onto their hand. Assessment by A&E confirmed the thumb was fractured and surgery was required.
Person reported missing from a boat on the river. Subsequent Police enquires found the victim had anchored and gone to shore, with the disappearance not related to the vessel.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Jetboat became beached in a channel on the Shotover river.
Observer on vessel sustained a piercing injury while handling a spiny dog shark. Basic first aid applied and voyage continued.
During routine vessel checks on a tanker it was noted that the fibre glass floor of the rescue boat was showing cracks. Vessel has back up rescue gear and floor of rescue boat was to be repaired.
Jetboat came across two kayakers directly in the drive line. The jetboat was unable to deviate due to obstacles and passed at a slow speed.
Event Location: 400m downstream from Te Marie Bridge, Whanganui River

Brief Description: During a planned spin, vessel grounded. Passengers transferred ashore.  Vessel pushed off bar and collected passengers downstream.
Container ship's bow thruster failed during approach to berth. Tugs assisted vessel into port.
Jet boat grounded during a planned spin. Boat recovered by tractor tow.
Crew member on yacht jumped off to help berth the boat and dislocated their knee. Surgeon on crew provided first aid before the ambulance arrived. Crew member was transported to hospital.
Charter passenger vessel lost propulsion following the failure of its alternator battery.

Yacht under sail collided with a small fishing vessel. The fishing vessel immediately took on water and began to sink. The two passengers held on until they were picked up by another vessel. There were no injuries.

Yacht under sail collided with a small fishing vessel. The fishing vessel immediately took on water and began to sink. The two passengers held on until they were picked up by another vessel. There were no injuries.
While running downstream doing a boat river test, incorrect channel selection resulting in grounding.
Jet Boat lost power and propulsion. Passengers disembarked on shore. Minor damage to the vessel sustained while idling downstream.

Recreational vessel hit mussel farm backbone causing vessel to stop suddenly and the skipper to be thrown violently within the vessel.  Rescued by Coastguard and hospitalized with broken ribs and vertebrae.
Vessel travelling at speed hit the wake of another vessel, destabilising the vessel and causing one crew member to lose footing and fall, sustaining a minor head injury.
First Engineer had a medical event causing numbness down their left side.
Passenger ferry lost steering and had to secure vessel with anchor. Skipper called for assistance and transferred two passengers to another vessel.
During fuel resupply old and new fuels became mixed causing filters to clog, resulting in a blackout of ship.
Container ship notified of a crack in boiler that had been temporarily repaired and assessed by surveyor. Permanent repair was to be completed before another inspection by attending surveyor.

Main motherboard for a generator on cargo ship failed and generator 2 was also out of service, the two larger generators were fully operational and running as normal. A module had been ordered for replacement.
Fishing net fouled propeller and stalled the main motor. Vessel was towed back to berth by Coastguard.
As a result of auto twist lock not releasing, single empty container fell onto deck of vessel.
Boat with three passengers onboard was swamped and capsized by a wave. No injuries sustained.
While undertaking driver training, the IRB struck a submerged surfer on the head.  Surfer lifted onboard and returned to shore for treatment.
Jet Boat travelling downstream starboard engine lost power while up on the plane. Unloaded 13 passengers and returned to base on one engine.
Commanding Officer of a container ship disembarked for medical reasons as advised by doctor as unfit for duty.
Failure of Autopilot/Trackpilot. Vessel was able to be safely navigated with hand steering.
Loss redundancy on PA system as required for passenger ships.  Mitigation measures in place.

Half an hour after surfacing, a diver from a commercial dive team advised they had chest pain and a tight feeling in upper chest, the team followed emergency medical protocol and sought medical advice. Boat returned to ramp and met ambulance.
Event Location: Southwest Home Bay, Great Mercury Island

Brief Description: Water pump had air lock causing hose to heat up and split. Hot water sprayed out, burning crew members chest.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Jetski driver lost sight of the next wave due to wash, the conditions were unpredictable and the driver was consequently knocked off.
Crew member was walking across gangway when they slipped between vessel and pier edge, sustaining bruising to their legs and arm.
While on route to berth, port main engine clutch slip warning alarm sounded. Port main engine stopped and issue identified.  Repairs to be undertaken in port.
Ladder rung gave way as digger operator was exiting Hold 1 of vessel.
Jetboat drifted towards bank and grounded after driver turned into corner.
Fishing trawler's main engine alarm sounded as the engine was shutting down. The backup engine then started automatically. Engineers worked through the system to locate and fix the issue.
Propulsion failure due to engine mount not securely bolted during recent cam shaft repair.
Driver on a practice run with a IRB lost balance and fell from the vessel.
Both radars on containership ceased functioning. Technician was assigned to repair at next port.
Tender was tied to pile.  Pile collapsed, pushing the stern underwater.
Vessel came into contact with seabed.  Were able to back off and resume voyage.  After inspection, damage to one propeller blade.
Individual fishing from their boat fell overboard and required assistance as they were unable to swim. Rescue helicopter attended and person was retrieved from water.
Charter vessel lost steering and had to berth with emergency steering drill and tiller arm.
Fishing vessel was towing a dinghy in rough weather when the rope broke and the dinghy was lost.
Fishing vessel was towing a dinghy in rough weather when the rope broke and the dinghy was lost.
Container ship experienced malfunction of the remote steering system. Equipment was to repaired and engine room was to be manned at all times prior to repair.
River levels dropped below normal, and after completing a planned spin jet boat hit a rock.
Crew member lost footing and injured their back. over the next couple of hours their condition deteriorated and an ambulance was called. Crew member was assessed in hospital.
Barge travelled to collect gear from the beach and hit a submerged item which punctured the port forward hull. Hole was patched up and vessel returned to port to be slipped and repaired.
At end of a planned turn, vessel made contact with ground causing small amount of damage to the protective bull bar. No injuries.
Crossing bar when wave broke on the bow of vessel, causing damage to upper port bow section above the deck line.
Pump to day tank failed, causing loss of propulsion. Coastguard towed vessel back to port.
On approach to slipway, vessel briefly grounded. Backed vessel off without incident.
Crew of a fishing vessel were setting a net when a crew member's foot became trapped in the back of the net, dragging it into the net roller. Crew member received treatment and stiches in hospital.

Ferry undergoing maintenance was found to have cracks in two of the gear teeth, and a higher than normal vibration in one of the gearboxes. Vessel was assessed by surveyor and some sailings were to be cancelled while new parts were in transit.
Fatal accident during a commercial operation.
Pallet jack used to stow pallets reversed over stevedore's foot and leg. Stevedore was sent to hospital for treatment.

Vessel was making routine journey when a deckhand detected the smell of fuel. Fuel discovered leaking from fuel breather hole on the side of the ship. Engine was stopped immediately. Vessel returned to base and fuel cleaned up with spill kit.
Ferry had a complete power outage whilst coming into port. Both engines and steering were down for 10 minutes, ferry was assisted into berth with the help of a tug.

Passenger ferry became aware of another vessel within close vicinity. Ferry reduced speed, sounded whistle and attempted contact on VHF. With no communication the ferry eventually aborted passage until the other vessel was sighted.
Crew member had an allergic reaction after ingesting food on board vessel. Crew member transferred to hospital for treatment.
Crew member was pulling in fishing line, when the line went slack and a hook went through the persons thumb. Was assessed in hospital.
During scheduled maintenance checks on a container ship, the chief officer caught their hand between the anchor chain and the anchor guide post, causing a serious injury.
Vessel made contact with navigational buoy when entering harbour.

Two vessels were leaving port when another vessel approached to pass on starboard side. Oncoming vessel altered direction to starboard cutting across a short distance away to pass on port side. 5 short blasts were sounded.

Two vessels were leaving port when another vessel approached to pass on starboard side. Oncoming vessel altered direction to starboard cutting across a short distance away to pass on port side. 5 short blasts were sounded.
Vessel was pushing a barge when the skipper noticed the vessel was not responding to steering controls. The vessel was stopped, the issue investigated and the rudder shaft was found to be broken.

Vessel was making routine journey, trailer onboard carrying LPG. Strong smell of gas was reported by crew. Trailer was inspected and deemed unsafe, so was docked and Fire Department notified and attended.
Beacon distress signal received from vessel with torn sails. Ship within vicinity responded, skipper advised they would return to port under own power.
Vessel grounded whilst making a planned turn.
Crew member noticed two small holes in engine room hull, they were plugged to stop ingress of water. Repairs were completed.
Crew noticed electrical burning smell, smell was identified and breakers turned off. Crew member continued fire watch.
Crew member was evacuated off fishing vessel after suffering a medical episode.
Passenger on ferry suffered a medical episode, vessel returned to harbour.
Fishing vessel sank after collision with rocks. Two crew members airlifted to hospital.
Crew member found a passenger losing consciousness. Vessel returned to marina and passenger was transported to hospital.
After lifting vessel off berth, vessel experienced a problem with bridge control of main engine. Vessel returned to berth and control restored.
Crew member fell on the deck during mooring operation and sustained a fractured arm.
The ship to shore crane was performing a lift on the vessel. When the containers were lifted out of the vessel's hold, the containers became detached from the crane spreader.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Generator on fishing vessel shut down due to possible fuel contamination. Vessel towed towards port whilst checks were completed.
Driver of the vessel misjudged a small wave when riding parallel to the shore, causing the boat to flip sideways.
Crane operator on container ship was watching the crane's claw and failed to observe another crane nearby, leading to a collision between them.
Vessel lost power due to blown coolant pipe. A temporary fix was put in place and the vessel waited in a sheltered position until another boat arrived to retrieve the vessel.
Engine failed to fire when pilot requested main engine dead slow ahead.  After several attempts tugs were called to support. A few minutes later engine fired and journey continued.

Vessel approached the turn around the point, increased the speed. The new speed was too high for the tight turn so the master stopped the vessel, at which point the tide and wind carried the vessel, making contact with the outer marina posts.
Vessel was moving between berths when master corrected course to avoid a beam. The vessel continued onto berth and came into contract with square fender pile.
Vessel's engine failed to start on departure due to reported water in start system. Water was drained from the system and engine was started after a few minutes.

Ferry experienced mechanical fault shortly after leaving terminal. After alarms skipper noticed steering was affected, they immediately put emergency plan into place, moved vessel to the side of harbour and advised passengers. Tug assisted to berth.
During the transfer of containers, a carrier came into contact with the hook of a vessel crane which was suspended over the wharf.
Vessel was hit by a second wave hidden by the initial breaking wave, causing the boat to be flipped when turning to the side.
Crew member slipped off a gangway with no handrails whilst boarding the vessel in high winds. Sustained minor injuries.
Vessel's radar began malfunctioning after heavy rain. Vessel took appropriate risk safety measures and service engineer attended vessel at Port of Auckland.
Fire crew attended unattended yacht that was on fire. They were able to extinguish the fire, and the vessel was towed back to port.
Deckhand was working on the front of the ship whilst mooring lines were being tied. The deckhand stepped backwards and fell from the platform deck to the main deck, resulting in a fractured arm.
Vessel's steering unit became inoperable due to damage to the pump shaft and coupling. Ship was able to navigate safely with a second steering unit.
Crew member was working on the deck of the vessel when a rogue wave came over the boat and swept them off of their feet into a hatch, causing a chest injury.

Vessel had developed leak in the back of the boat which was found by the crew and a dive team was contracted to apply a patch. The leak was monitored on return to harbour and the vessel was taken out of service until repaired.

Vessel's starter motor failed, leaving the boat without power. Call was made to the coast guard and another vessel was dispatched to attempt to start motor with a battery pack but was unsuccessful, so the boat was towed back to port.
Passenger ferry grounded on passage to next port as a result of steering failure. There were no injuries and vessel was refloated at next high tide.
Vessel was practicing slow training landings when it was discovered the throttle wasn't functioning correctly. Vessel proceeded to harbour, and Coastguard assisted to berth.
During planned spin passenger lost balance and hit their hand, sustaining a finger fracture.
Fatal recreational boating accident.
Vessel was performing a routine landing on a concrete ramp in strong winds. Front of the vessel came into contact with the ramp.
Recreational vessel became caught on the net of a trawler. Occupants of the vessel called for help on the radio before the vessel foundered and were rescued by another vessel in the vicinity.
While attempting to tie up vessel, crew member's arm was trapped between the boat and the jetty, resulting in a minor injury.

Vessel was making a routine journey when crew were alerted to a fire and oil pressure alarm, onboard engineer investigated. Oil filter was found to have failed, master decided to return to the marina under a single engine with help from a tugboat.
Vessel reported a shift in cargo during transit and continued onto port. Ship was deemed to be safe to dock.
Vessel's generator experienced an issue and shut down, causing a blackout. Backup generator on standby activated and power was restored.
A fishing vessel berthed behind a sailing vessel made contact with the sailing vessel as they were both moored, causing damage to the bow.
A fishing vessel berthed behind a sailing vessel made contact with the sailing vessel as they were both moored, causing damage to the bow.

Container ship advised of a power failure of the deck auxiliary generator. The fuel filters were found to be blocked due to contamination in the inbuilt fuel tank. The filters were replaced and the generator returned to service.
Crew member slipped whilst boarding vessel, sustaining a minor injury to their hip.
IRB driver didn't get enough speed up whilst driving away from a peaking wave and the wave crashed over the vessel, causing it to flip.
Vessel was beached intentionally as part of a training exercise. As vessel was relaunched sand entered the engine cooling system and it shut down.
Main engine seized while towing and vessel was towed back to port.
Pilot reported damage to gangway due to metal plate catching on port wharf.
Crew member hit their head on fishing equipment stowed above them, sustaining bruising.
Crew member fell overboard while undertaking IRB training.
IRB driver attempted to proceed over a wave, hitting it at a steep angle and causing the IRB to roll over.
